Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "radical jordanian cleric, abu qatada, and nine other foreign nationals said to pose a threat to the uk's security, have been detained, pending deportation.\n The question is: 10 foreign nationals were a threat to britian's national security.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false", '"i want to go back again. but i am afraid, honestly, i am afraid. propaganda against me made people think i am terrorist.", said el-nashar.\n The question is: el-nashar is accused of terrorism.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'a cuban american who is accused of espionage pleads innocent.\n The question is: american accused of espionage. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'a syrian-american airman accused of espionage complained about prisoner treatment at the us base in guantanamo, cuba.\n The question is: american accused of espionage. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'jose padilla, who is a former chicago gang member, was found by jury to be guilty of supporting islamic terrorist groups abroad. the co-defendants, adham hassoun and kifan jayyousi were also found guilty on conspiracy to murder, kidnap, and maim people in a foreign country; conspiracy to provide material support for terrorists; and providing material support for terrorists.\n The question is: jose padilla did not support terrorism.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'this explanation was rejected by the government of chile, who insist that pinochet enjoys diplomatic immunity in his capacity as "an elected member in the senate for life" since leaving the command of the armed forces last march.\n The question is: the chilean government affirming that as a member of the senate, pinochet has diplomatic immunity.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'the decision by the british government to suspend flights to kenya is regrettable, it plays into the hands of terrorists.\n The question is: the british government banned flights to kenya.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'protesters, many from organized pro-government groups but including many ordinary citizens, carried anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.\n The question is: protesters confiscated anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', '"instead of action on crime, we got the federal long gun registry, which became a bloated bureaucratic nightmare to responsible hunters, farmers and rural canadians. it cost taxpayers some ca$2 billion and it hasn\'t done a thing to reduce gun crime." said harper. the conservatives have provided amnesty for unregistered gun owners. at this time there is no legislation set before the house of commons. conservative garry breitkreuz from saskatchewan tabled the bill killing the long-gun registry.\n The question is: garry breitkreuz is a member of the conservative party.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', "the board of marks & spencer will take another look at philip green's increased takeover offer.\n The question is: philip green tries to take over marks & spencer.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", 'the university has also apologized for the incident saying, "[we] are very sorry that the incident happened and the person will be dealt with according to law. the university is a place for discussion, debate and considered argument, not for shoe throwing". according to authorities, there was never any real threat to the prime minister. the man will appear before a judge on february 10.\n The question is: a man threw a shoe at the prime minister.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'any taxpayer earning over £150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns £200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on £200 a month or £2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true']

jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.', 'hypothesis': 'greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.', 'label': 'false'}, {'premise': Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "radical jordanian cleric, abu qatada, and nine other foreign nationals said to pose a threat to the uk's security, have been detained, pending deportation.\n The question is: 10 foreign nationals were a threat to britian's national security.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false", '"i want to go back again. but i am afraid, honestly, i am afraid. propaganda against me made people think i am terrorist.", said el-nashar.\n The question is: el-nashar is accused of terrorism.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'a cuban american who is accused of espionage pleads innocent.\n The question is: american accused of espionage. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'a syrian-american airman accused of espionage complained about prisoner treatment at the us base in guantanamo, cuba.\n The question is: american accused of espionage. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'jose padilla, who is a former chicago gang member, was found by jury to be guilty of supporting islamic terrorist groups abroad. the co-defendants, adham hassoun and kifan jayyousi were also found guilty on conspiracy to murder, kidnap, and maim people in a foreign country; conspiracy to provide material support for terrorists; and providing material support for terrorists.\n The question is: jose padilla did not support terrorism.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'this explanation was rejected by the government of chile, who insist that pinochet enjoys diplomatic immunity in his capacity as "an elected member in the senate for life" since leaving the command of the armed forces last march.\n The question is: the chilean government affirming that as a member of the senate, pinochet has diplomatic immunity.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'the decision by the british government to suspend flights to kenya is regrettable, it plays into the hands of terrorists.\n The question is: the british government banned flights to kenya.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'protesters, many from organized pro-government groups but including many ordinary citizens, carried anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.\n The question is: protesters confiscated anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', '"instead of action on crime, we got the federal long gun registry, which became a bloated bureaucratic nightmare to responsible hunters, farmers and rural canadians. it cost taxpayers some ca$2 billion and it hasn\'t done a thing to reduce gun crime." said harper. the conservatives have provided amnesty for unregistered gun owners. at this time there is no legislation set before the house of commons. conservative garry breitkreuz from saskatchewan tabled the bill killing the long-gun registry.\n The question is: garry breitkreuz is a member of the conservative party.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "the board of marks & spencer will take another look at philip green's increased takeover offer.\n The question is: philip green tries to take over marks & spencer.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", 'the university has also apologized for the incident saying, "[we] are very sorry that the incident happened and the person will be dealt with according to law. the university is a place for discussion, debate and considered argument, not for shoe throwing". according to authorities, there was never any real threat to the prime minister. the man will appear before a judge on february 10.\n The question is: a man threw a shoe at the prime minister.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'any taxpayer earning over £150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns £200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on £200 a month or £2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false']

Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', '"instead of action on crime, we got the federal long gun registry, which became a bloated bureaucratic nightmare to responsible hunters, farmers and rural canadians. it cost taxpayers some ca$2 billion and it hasn\'t done a thing to reduce gun crime." said harper. the conservatives have provided amnesty for unregistered gun owners. at this time there is no legislation set before the house of commons. conservative garry breitkreuz from saskatchewan tabled the bill killing the long-gun registry.\n The question is: garry breitkreuz is a member of the conservative party.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', "the board of marks & spencer will take another look at philip green's increased takeover offer.\n The question is: philip green tries to take over marks & spencer.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", 'the university has also apologized for the incident saying, "[we] are very sorry that the incident happened and the person will be dealt with according to law. the university is a place for discussion, debate and considered argument, not for shoe throwing". according to authorities, there was never any real threat to the prime minister. the man will appear before a judge on february 10.\n The question is: a man threw a shoe at the prime minister.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'any taxpayer earning over £150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns £200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on £200 a month or £2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false']

which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety 'any taxpayer earning over £150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns £200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on £200 a month or £2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.', 'hypothesis': 'alistair darling is chancellor of uk.', 'label': 'false'}]]
Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "radical jordanian cleric, abu qatada, and nine other foreign nationals said to pose a threat to the uk's security, have been detained, pending deportation.\n The question is: 10 foreign nationals were a threat to britian's national security.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", '"i want to go back again. but i am afraid, honestly, i am afraid. propaganda against me made people think i am terrorist.", said el-nashar.\n The question is: el-nashar is accused of terrorism.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'a cuban american who is accused of espionage pleads innocent.\n The question is: american accused of espionage. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'a syrian-american airman accused of espionage complained about prisoner treatment at the us base in guantanamo, cuba.\n The question is: american accused of espionage. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'jose padilla, who is a former chicago gang member, was found by jury to be guilty of supporting islamic terrorist groups abroad. the co-defendants, adham hassoun and kifan jayyousi were also found guilty on conspiracy to murder, kidnap, and maim people in a foreign country; conspiracy to provide material support for terrorists; and providing material support for terrorists.\n The question is: jose padilla did not support terrorism.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'this explanation was rejected by the government of chile, who insist that pinochet enjoys diplomatic immunity in his capacity as "an elected member in the senate for life" since leaving the command of the armed forces last march.\n The question is: the chilean government affirming that as a member of the senate, pinochet has diplomatic immunity.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'the decision by the british government to suspend flights to kenya is regrettable, it plays into the hands of terrorists.\n The question is: the british government banned flights to kenya.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'protesters, many from organized pro-government groups but including many ordinary citizens, carried anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.\n The question is: protesters confiscated anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', '"instead of action on crime, we got the federal long gun registry, which became a bloated bureaucratic nightmare to responsible hunters, farmers and rural canadians. it cost taxpayers some ca$2 billion and it hasn\'t done a thing to reduce gun crime." said harper. the conservatives have provided amnesty for unregistered gun owners. at this time there is no legislation set before the house of commons. conservative garry breitkreuz from saskatchewan tabled the bill killing the long-gun registry.\n The question is: garry breitkreuz is a member of the conservative party.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', "the board of marks & spencer will take another look at philip green's increased takeover offer.\n The question is: philip green tries to take over marks & spencer.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", 'the university has also apologized for the incident saying, "[we] are very sorry that the incident happened and the person will be dealt with according to law. the university is a place for discussion, debate and considered argument, not for shoe throwing". according to authorities, there was never any real threat to the prime minister. the man will appear before a judge on february 10.\n The question is: a man threw a shoe at the prime minister.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'any taxpayer earning over £150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns £200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on £200 a month or £2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false']

True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'any taxpayer earning over £150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns £200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on £200 a month or £2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', "radical jordanian cleric, abu qatada, and nine other foreign nationals said to pose a threat to the uk's security, have been detained, pending deportation.\n The question is: 10 foreign nationals were a threat to britian's national security.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false", '"i want to go back again. but i am afraid, honestly, i am afraid. propaganda against me made people think i am terrorist.", said el-nashar.\n The question is: el-nashar is accused of terrorism.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'a cuban american who is accused of espionage pleads innocent.\n The question is: american accused of espionage. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'a syrian-american airman accused of espionage complained about prisoner treatment at the us base in guantanamo, cuba.\n The question is: american accused of espionage. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'jose padilla, who is a former chicago gang member, was found by jury to be guilty of supporting islamic terrorist groups abroad. the co-defendants, adham hassoun and kifan jayyousi were also found guilty on conspiracy to murder, kidnap, and maim people in a foreign country; conspiracy to provide material support for terrorists; and providing material support for terrorists.\n The question is: jose padilla did not support terrorism.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'this explanation was rejected by the government of chile, who insist that pinochet enjoys diplomatic immunity in his capacity as "an elected member in the senate for life" since leaving the command of the armed forces last march.\n The question is: the chilean government affirming that as a member of the senate, pinochet has diplomatic immunity.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'the decision by the british government to suspend flights to kenya is regrettable, it plays into the hands of terrorists.\n The question is: the british government banned flights to kenya.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'protesters, many from organized pro-government groups but including many ordinary citizens, carried anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.\n The question is: protesters confiscated anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', '"instead of action on crime, we got the federal long gun registry, which became a bloated bureaucratic nightmare to responsible hunters, farmers and rural canadians. it cost taxpayers some ca$2 billion and it hasn\'t done a thing to reduce gun crime." said harper. the conservatives have provided amnesty for unregistered gun owners. at this time there is no legislation set before the house of commons. conservative garry breitkreuz from saskatchewan tabled the bill killing the long-gun registry.\n The question is: garry breitkreuz is a member of the conservative party.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', "the board of marks & spencer will take another look at philip green's increased takeover offer.\n The question is: philip green tries to take over marks & spencer.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", 'the university has also apologized for the incident saying, "[we] are very sorry that the incident happened and the person will be dealt with according to law. the university is a place for discussion, debate and considered argument, not for shoe throwing". according to authorities, there was never any real threat to the prime minister. the man will appear before a judge on february 10.\n The question is: a man threw a shoe at the prime minister.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'any taxpayer earning over £150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns £200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on £200 a month or £2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false']

jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.', 'hypothesis': 'greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.', 'label': 'false'}, {'premise': Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "radical jordanian cleric, abu qatada, and nine other foreign nationals said to pose a threat to the uk's security, have been detained, pending deportation.\n The question is: 10 foreign nationals were a threat to britian's national security.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false", '"i want to go back again. but i am afraid, honestly, i am afraid. propaganda against me made people think i am terrorist.", said el-nashar.\n The question is: el-nashar is accused of terrorism.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'a cuban american who is accused of espionage pleads innocent.\n The question is: american accused of espionage. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'a syrian-american airman accused of espionage complained about prisoner treatment at the us base in guantanamo, cuba.\n The question is: american accused of espionage. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'jose padilla, who is a former chicago gang member, was found by jury to be guilty of supporting islamic terrorist groups abroad. the co-defendants, adham hassoun and kifan jayyousi were also found guilty on conspiracy to murder, kidnap, and maim people in a foreign country; conspiracy to provide material support for terrorists; and providing material support for terrorists.\n The question is: jose padilla did not support terrorism.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'this explanation was rejected by the government of chile, who insist that pinochet enjoys diplomatic immunity in his capacity as "an elected member in the senate for life" since leaving the command of the armed forces last march.\n The question is: the chilean government affirming that as a member of the senate, pinochet has diplomatic immunity.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'the decision by the british government to suspend flights to kenya is regrettable, it plays into the hands of terrorists.\n The question is: the british government banned flights to kenya.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'protesters, many from organized pro-government groups but including many ordinary citizens, carried anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.\n The question is: protesters confiscated anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', '"instead of action on crime, we got the federal long gun registry, which became a bloated bureaucratic nightmare to responsible hunters, farmers and rural canadians. it cost taxpayers some ca$2 billion and it hasn\'t done a thing to reduce gun crime." said harper. the conservatives have provided amnesty for unregistered gun owners. at this time there is no legislation set before the house of commons. conservative garry breitkreuz from saskatchewan tabled the bill killing the long-gun registry.\n The question is: garry breitkreuz is a member of the conservative party.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', "the board of marks & spencer will take another look at philip green's increased takeover offer.\n The question is: philip green tries to take over marks & spencer.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", 'the university has also apologized for the incident saying, "[we] are very sorry that the incident happened and the person will be dealt with according to law. the university is a place for discussion, debate and considered argument, not for shoe throwing". according to authorities, there was never any real threat to the prime minister. the man will appear before a judge on february 10.\n The question is: a man threw a shoe at the prime minister.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'any taxpayer earning over £150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns £200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on £200 a month or £2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false']

Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', '"instead of action on crime, we got the federal long gun registry, which became a bloated bureaucratic nightmare to responsible hunters, farmers and rural canadians. it cost taxpayers some ca$2 billion and it hasn\'t done a thing to reduce gun crime." said harper. the conservatives have provided amnesty for unregistered gun owners. at this time there is no legislation set before the house of commons. conservative garry breitkreuz from saskatchewan tabled the bill killing the long-gun registry.\n The question is: garry breitkreuz is a member of the conservative party.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', "the board of marks & spencer will take another look at philip green's increased takeover offer.\n The question is: philip green tries to take over marks & spencer.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'any taxpayer earning over £150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns £200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on £200 a month or £2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false']

which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety 'any taxpayer earning over £150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns £200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on £200 a month or £2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.', 'hypothesis': 'alistair darling is chancellor of uk.', 'label': 'false'}]]
Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "radical jordanian cleric, abu qatada, and nine other foreign nationals said to pose a threat to the uk's security, have been detained, pending deportation.\n The question is: 10 foreign nationals were a threat to britian's national security.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false", '"i want to go back again. but i am afraid, honestly, i am afraid. propaganda against me made people think i am terrorist.", said el-nashar.\n The question is: el-nashar is accused of terrorism.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'a cuban american who is accused of espionage pleads innocent.\n The question is: american accused of espionage. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'a syrian-american airman accused of espionage complained about prisoner treatment at the us base in guantanamo, cuba.\n The question is: american accused of espionage. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'jose padilla, who is a former chicago gang member, was found by jury to be guilty of supporting islamic terrorist groups abroad. the co-defendants, adham hassoun and kifan jayyousi were also found guilty on conspiracy to murder, kidnap, and maim people in a foreign country; conspiracy to provide material support for terrorists; and providing material support for terrorists.\n The question is: jose padilla did not support terrorism.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'this explanation was rejected by the government of chile, who insist that pinochet enjoys diplomatic immunity in his capacity as "an elected member in the senate for life" since leaving the command of the armed forces last march.\n The question is: the chilean government affirming that as a member of the senate, pinochet has diplomatic immunity.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'the decision by the british government to suspend flights to kenya is regrettable, it plays into the hands of terrorists.\n The question is: the british government banned flights to kenya.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'protesters, many from organized pro-government groups but including many ordinary citizens, carried anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.\n The question is: protesters confiscated anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', '"instead of action on crime, we got the federal long gun registry, which became a bloated bureaucratic nightmare to responsible hunters, farmers and rural canadians. it cost taxpayers some ca$2 billion and it hasn\'t done a thing to reduce gun crime." said harper. the conservatives have provided amnesty for unregistered gun owners. at this time there is no legislation set before the house of commons. conservative garry breitkreuz from saskatchewan tabled the bill killing the long-gun registry.\n The question is: garry breitkreuz is a member of the conservative party.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', "the board of marks & spencer will take another look at philip green's increased takeover offer.\n The question is: philip green tries to take over marks & spencer.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", 'the university has also apologized for the incident saying, "[we] are very sorry that the incident happened and the person will be dealt with according to law. the university is a place for discussion, debate and considered argument, not for shoe throwing". according to authorities, there was never any real threat to the prime minister. the man will appear before a judge on february 10.\n The question is: a man threw a shoe at the prime minister.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'any taxpayer earning over £150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns £200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on £200 a month or £2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false']

True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'any taxpayer earning over £150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns £200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on £200 a month or £2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false']

Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "radical jordanian cleric, abu qatada, and nine other foreign nationals said to pose a threat to the uk's security, have been detained, pending deportation.\n The question is: 10 foreign nationals were a threat to britian's national security.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false", '"i want to go back again. but i am afraid, honestly, i am afraid. propaganda against me made people think i am terrorist.", said el-nashar.\n The question is: el-nashar is accused of terrorism.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'a cuban american who is accused of espionage pleads innocent.\n The question is: american accused of espionage. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'a syrian-american airman accused of espionage complained about prisoner treatment at the us base in guantanamo, cuba.\n The question is: american accused of espionage. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'jose padilla, who is a former chicago gang member, was found by jury to be guilty of supporting islamic terrorist groups abroad. the co-defendants, adham hassoun and kifan jayyousi were also found guilty on conspiracy to murder, kidnap, and maim people in a foreign country; conspiracy to provide material support for terrorists; and providing material support for terrorists.\n The question is: jose padilla did not support terrorism.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'this explanation was rejected by the government of chile, who insist that pinochet enjoys diplomatic immunity in his capacity as "an elected member in the senate for life" since leaving the command of the armed forces last march.\n The question is: the chilean government affirming that as a member of the senate, pinochet has diplomatic immunity.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'the decision by the british government to suspend flights to kenya is regrettable, it plays into the hands of terrorists.\n The question is: the british government banned flights to kenya.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'protesters, many from organized pro-government groups but including many ordinary citizens, carried anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.\n The question is: protesters confiscated anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', '"instead of action on crime, we got the federal long gun registry, which became a bloated bureaucratic nightmare to responsible hunters, farmers and rural canadians. it cost taxpayers some ca$2 billion and it hasn\'t done a thing to reduce gun crime." said harper. the conservatives have provided amnesty for unregistered gun owners. at this time there is no legislation set before the house of commons. conservative garry breitkreuz from saskatchewan tabled the bill killing the long-gun registry.\n The question is: garry breitkreuz is a member of the conservative party.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', "the board of marks & spencer will take another look at philip green's increased takeover offer.\n The question is: philip green tries to take over marks & spencer.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", 'the university has also apologized for the incident saying, "[we] are very sorry that the incident happened and the person will be dealt with according to law. the university is a place for discussion, debate and considered argument, not for shoe throwing". according to authorities, there was never any real threat to the prime minister. the man will appear before a judge on february 10.\n The question is: a man threw a shoe at the prime minister.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'any taxpayer earning over £150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns £200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on £200 a month or £2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false']

jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.', 'hypothesis': 'greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.', 'label': 'false'}, {'premise': Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "radical jordanian cleric, abu qatada, and nine other foreign nationals said to pose a threat to the uk's security, have been detained, pending deportation.\n The question is: 10 foreign nationals were a threat to britian's national security.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false", '"i want to go back again. but i am afraid, honestly, i am afraid. propaganda against me made people think i am terrorist.", said el-nashar.\n The question is: el-nashar is accused of terrorism.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'a cuban american who is accused of espionage pleads innocent.\n The question is: american accused of espionage. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'a syrian-american airman accused of espionage complained about prisoner treatment at the us base in guantanamo, cuba.\n The question is: american accused of espionage. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'jose padilla, who is a former chicago gang member, was found by jury to be guilty of supporting islamic terrorist groups abroad. the co-defendants, adham hassoun and kifan jayyousi were also found guilty on conspiracy to murder, kidnap, and maim people in a foreign country; conspiracy to provide material support for terrorists; and providing material support for terrorists.\n The question is: jose padilla did not support terrorism.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'this explanation was rejected by the government of chile, who insist that pinochet enjoys diplomatic immunity in his capacity as "an elected member in the senate for life" since leaving the command of the armed forces last march.\n The question is: the chilean government affirming that as a member of the senate, pinochet has diplomatic immunity.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'the decision by the british government to suspend flights to kenya is regrettable, it plays into the hands of terrorists.\n The question is: the british government banned flights to kenya.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'protesters, many from organized pro-government groups but including many ordinary citizens, carried anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.\n The question is: protesters confiscated anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', '"instead of action on crime, we got the federal long gun registry, which became a bloated bureaucratic nightmare to responsible hunters, farmers and rural canadians. it cost taxpayers some ca$2 billion and it hasn\'t done a thing to reduce gun crime." said harper. the conservatives have provided amnesty for unregistered gun owners. at this time there is no legislation set before the house of commons. conservative garry breitkreuz from saskatchewan tabled the bill killing the long-gun registry.\n The question is: garry breitkreuz is a member of the conservative party.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', "the board of marks & spencer will take another look at philip green's increased takeover offer.\n The question is: philip green tries to take over marks & spencer.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", 'the university has also apologized for the incident saying, "[we] are very sorry that the incident happened and the person will be dealt with according to law. the university is a place for discussion, debate and considered argument, not for shoe throwing". according to authorities, there was never any real threat to the prime minister. the man will appear before a judge on february 10.\n The question is: a man threw a shoe at the prime minister.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'any taxpayer earning over £150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns £200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on £200 a month or £2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false']

Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', '"instead of action on crime, we got the federal long gun registry, which became a bloated bureaucratic nightmare to responsible hunters, farmers and rural canadians. it cost taxpayers some ca$2 billion and it hasn\'t done a thing to reduce gun crime." said harper. the conservatives have provided amnesty for unregistered gun owners. at this time there is no legislation set before the house of commons. conservative garry breitkreuz from saskatchewan tabled the bill killing the long-gun registry.\n The question is: garry breitkreuz is a member of the conservative party.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', "the board of marks & spencer will take another look at philip green's increased takeover offer.\n The question is: philip green tries to take over marks & spencer.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'any taxpayer earning over £150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns £200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on £200 a month or £2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false']

which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety 'any taxpayer earning over £150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns £200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on £200 a month or £2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.', 'hypothesis': 'alistair darling is chancellor of uk.', 'label': 'true'}]]
Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "radical jordanian cleric, abu qatada, and nine other foreign nationals said to pose a threat to the uk's security, have been detained, pending deportation.\n The question is: 10 foreign nationals were a threat to britian's national security.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false", '"i want to go back again. but i am afraid, honestly, i am afraid. propaganda against me made people think i am terrorist.", said el-nashar.\n The question is: el-nashar is accused of terrorism.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'a cuban american who is accused of espionage pleads innocent.\n The question is: american accused of espionage. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'a syrian-american airman accused of espionage complained about prisoner treatment at the us base in guantanamo, cuba.\n The question is: american accused of espionage. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'jose padilla, who is a former chicago gang member, was found by jury to be guilty of supporting islamic terrorist groups abroad. the co-defendants, adham hassoun and kifan jayyousi were also found guilty on conspiracy to murder, kidnap, and maim people in a foreign country; conspiracy to provide material support for terrorists; and providing material support for terrorists.\n The question is: jose padilla did not support terrorism.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'this explanation was rejected by the government of chile, who insist that pinochet enjoys diplomatic immunity in his capacity as "an elected member in the senate for life" since leaving the command of the armed forces last march.\n The question is: the chilean government affirming that as a member of the senate, pinochet has diplomatic immunity.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'the decision by the british government to suspend flights to kenya is regrettable, it plays into the hands of terrorists.\n The question is: the british government banned flights to kenya.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'protesters, many from organized pro-government groups but including many ordinary citizens, carried anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.\n The question is: protesters confiscated anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', '"instead of action on crime, we got the federal long gun registry, which became a bloated bureaucratic nightmare to responsible hunters, farmers and rural canadians. it cost taxpayers some ca$2 billion and it hasn\'t done a thing to reduce gun crime." said harper. the conservatives have provided amnesty for unregistered gun owners. at this time there is no legislation set before the house of commons. conservative garry breitkreuz from saskatchewan tabled the bill killing the long-gun registry.\n The question is: garry breitkreuz is a member of the conservative party.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', "the board of marks & spencer will take another look at philip green's increased takeover offer.\n The question is: philip green tries to take over marks & spencer.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", 'the university has also apologized for the incident saying, "[we] are very sorry that the incident happened and the person will be dealt with according to law. the university is a place for discussion, debate and considered argument, not for shoe throwing". according to authorities, there was never any real threat to the prime minister. the man will appear before a judge on february 10.\n The question is: a man threw a shoe at the prime minister.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'any taxpayer earning over £150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns £200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on £200 a month or £2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true']

True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', '"instead of action on crime, we got the federal long gun registry, which became a bloated bureaucratic nightmare to responsible hunters, farmers and rural canadians. it cost taxpayers some ca$2 billion and it hasn\'t done a thing to reduce gun crime." said harper. the conservatives have provided amnesty for unregistered gun owners. at this time there is no legislation set before the house of commons. conservative garry breitkreuz from saskatchewan tabled the bill killing the long-gun registry.\n The question is: garry breitkreuz is a member of the conservative party.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'any taxpayer earning over £150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns £200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on £200 a month or £2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false']
